cv-cards.skills_text:
Computer Skills:
Microsoft word, Excel, Access, QuickBooks, Peachtree, System 3000 (fund accounting), Tax wise, Timberline.

Qualifications Summary

• Over 13 years experience in Accounting with a proven performance record, solid work
ethic and commitment to excellence

• Keys to success include strengths in project management, organization, and interpersonal
abilities

• Computer proficiency especially demonstrated by smooth transitions through
system upgrades and enhancements. Skilled in Fed Advantage, SYMITAR, Synergy,
and Microsoft Office.

• Detailed, accurate and timely completion of assignments
cv-cards.resume_as_text:
Thomas Holland PO Box 760, Bryn Athyn, PA 19009 • 703-220-1128 • twholland888@verizon.net

Qualifications Summary

• Over 13 years experience in Accounting with a proven performance record, solid work
ethic and commitment to excellence

• Keys to success include strengths in project management, organization, and interpersonal
 abilities

• Computer proficiency especially demonstrated by smooth transitions through
system upgrades and enhancements. Skilled in Fed Advantage, SYMITAR, Synergy,
and Microsoft Office.

• Detailed, accurate and timely completion of assignments

Experience

Staff Accountant, ACH Coordinator 2014 - present
United States Senate Federal Credit Union, Alexandria, VA

Cash Management responsibilities for posting automated clearing house (ACH) electronic
funds transfers (EFT/Federal Reserve) for payroll and debit purchases.Additionally the ACH Coordinator is responsible for research of federal and international wire transfers, check (draft) processing, unauthorized ACH returns and Notices of Corrections (NOC). ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDE:

	• Seamless transition through major job description changes

Assistant Controller/Staff Accountant 2013 - 2014
Academy of the New Church, Bryn Athyn, PA

Provided support in accountancy for multi-million dollar Non-profit educational and
religious organization with specific responsibilities in, payroll/benefit administration,
general ledger, A/P, A/R, depreciation, allocations, reconciliations, reporting, fund transfers, analysis, tax, as well as audit and budget support. ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDED:

• Maintained high level of service and operations through major system changes
 and upgrades
• Developed tool allocating employment-related costs over extended period
• Expedited journal voucher process by providing appropriate support data
• Achieved deadline requirements for the identification sales tax items of
 work-in-process accounts


Cash Receipts Accountant 2012 - 2013
Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., Warminster, PA

Collected daily cash revenues including electronic transactions. Maintained accurate accounts on customized retail application. ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDED:

• Consistently received positive performance evaluations
• Promoted from sales associate to cash receipts associate within six weeks
Thomas Holland, page 2

Accounts Payable Accountant 2011 – 2012
Franklin Systems, Inc., Atlanta, GA

Managed accounts payable for corporation. Reviewed invoices and approved payments; resolved discrepancies; coordinated cash flow requirements for scheduled payables and monthly reporting; administered payroll utilizing ADP.

Sales/Membership Representative 2010 - 2011
Auto Club South (AAA), Atlanta, GA
Generated customer leads through brochure distribution and “cold calls,” leading to new accounts.

Store Manager 1989 - 1990
Kobacker Company, San Rafael, CA

Directed retail operations including point of sale marketing, staffing, inventory control, facility management, and financial reporting. Provided other stores with assistance and training of associates.

Sales Broker 1986 - 1989
Century 21, Broward County, FL

Commercial and residential real estate sales.

MILITARY SERVICE

Yeoman Third Class, United States Navy • 1979 - 1983, Honorable Discharge

EDUCATION

DeVry University			Watson School of Real Estate
Atlanta, GA				Tampa, FL
BS, Accounting 1994			Instructor’s License 1990

Santa Fe Community College
Gainesville, FL
Business Courses 1983 -1986

Ongoing training: MACHA, ACH Seminars

2004, Human Resources Training certificate program (non-credit),
Bucks County Community College
Bucks County, PA

Annual Sales & Use Tax Seminar
Excel Users Seminars
Rockhurst University of Kansas City, Pennsylvania locations

Steven McCall
steven.mccall@Imperiatech.com
(856) 404-8375

To become a successful Financial Analyst and begin a long-term career with a leading financial services firm.

cv-cards.resume_as_text:
To Whom It May Concern,

Recently, LinkedIn omitted the ability for candidates to include a cover letter during the application process thus restricting us to provide only a resume. That said, I have taken the liberty to write a few words about myself as a point of introduction, followed by my resume below.

I am interested in your job posting for an Executive Assistant and I would like to learn more about the opportunity.

Throughout my career, I have maintained high performance standards within a diverse range of administrative functions, illustrated by my past 20 years as an Executive Assistant to C-Level Executives.

I have recently returned to New York from a one year sabbatical and I would welcome the opportunity to meet with you to discuss my qualifications and candidacy in further detail. Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Rachel Chonchon
917-703-0097


RACHEL CHONCHON
350 Central Park West
New York, NY 10025
Cell (917) 703-0097
E-mail: Rachelinejoseph@hotmail.com
___________________________________________________________________________________

Condé Nast 					 	 8/2010 – 4/2012
Executive Assistant – SVP/Chief Communications Officer

 ▪ Executive Assistant to the SVP/Chief Communications Officer. Interfaced with offices of the Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President.

 ▪ Managed communication affairs for 18 publications including Vogue, Glamour, Vanity Fair, Architectural Digest, Bon Appétit and eleven other national and international magazines.

 ▪ Prepared Press Releases and News Announcements for publications. Responsible for scheduling over 40 newspaper and magazine reporters. Maintained Intranet Corporate Calendar

 ▪ Prepared quarterly Brand Statistics Portfolios for 18 magazines and senior executives. Statistics comprised of brand awards, nominations, app and digital launches, corporate calendar events, social media updates and milestones.

 ▪ Prepared annual report for the Chairman concerning ASME (American Society of Magazine Editors) nominations and awards.

Condé Nast, a division of Advance Publications, operates in 25 countries. In the United States, Condé Nast publishes eighteen consumer magazines, two trade publications and twenty-seven websites.
______________________________________________________________________________________

Equinox Group Corporation				 1/2005 - 10/2008
Executive Assistant - Chief Executive Officer

 ▪ Executive Assistant to the Chief Executive Officer.

 ▪ Resolved >85% of corporate issues/matters on behalf of CEO.

 ▪ Principal liaison for 45 independent company locations across the United States.
Maintained executive calendar and contacts for over 300 executives and companies.

 ▪ Responsible for domestic and international travel arrangements for CEO and Board of directors.

 ▪ Managed general administration, correspondence and corporate office with staff of eight associates and responsible for the receptionist and temporary hires.

 ▪ Directed Facilities Department with regard to the corporate office, ordering services, equipment maintenance and catering.

Equinox, dedicated to Health & Fitness. Operating nationally in 10 cities across the United States. A division of the Related Companies.


Internet Management Services 				 3/2001 - 11/2004
Executive Assistant - Chief Executive Officer
& Chief Financial Officer

 ▪ Executive Assistant to CEO and CFO who were the sole proprietors of the business.

 ▪ Established office structure of the start-up business.

 ▪ Established general personnel practices and created employee manual for medical benefits, vacation, sick leave and general personnel activities. Prepared payroll system, 401K parameters, financial management of Paychex and corporate travel account.

 ▪ Developed systems for telephones, postage, courier, car service, catering accounts, maintained office inventory and managed vendors for office equipment, furniture, supplies, food and meals.

 ▪ Maintained calendar, international travel and general administrative functions for CEO and CFO. Scheduled Board meetings, conferences and day-to-day functions with general staff.

 ▪ Responsible for personal activities of the business proprietors including business expenses, bookkeeping, vacations, arranged private family travels.

Internet Management Services, an Asian gambling website with offices in New York, Antigua and China.
______________________________________________________________________________________

Barnes & Noble.com 					 1/2000 - 2/2001
Executive Assistant - Vice-President of Brand Marketing

 ▪ Executive Assistant for Vice-President of Brand Marketing. Provided administrative support for the Director of Public Relations, Director of Marketing and eight additional staff within the department.

 ▪ Maintained $12 million department budget with direct interface to Barnes & Noble accounting department.

 ▪ Coordinated travel plans, flights, hotel reservations, dinners and lunches. Scheduled internal and off-site meetings, seminars & conferences.

 ▪ Arranged weekly marketing meetings and prepared Marketing Department
 Forecast Reports for the Corporate Brand.

 ▪ Processed HR paperwork for new employees.

 ▪ Planned events to launch book promotions and author signings.

BN.com, online start up for Barnes & Noble. A source of information and sales.


Education & Core Competencies

 ▪ Concordia University – Montreal, Canada

 ▪ Bachelor of Arts Degree; French and English Translation

 ▪ Languages: Fluent in French, Spanish, Hebrew and Arabic

 ▪ Supported C-Level Executives; Vice-Presidents, Presidents & Chief Executive Officers

 ▪ Handled complexity of 45 independent business units

 ▪ Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office programs

 ▪ Bookkeeping, Quickbooks , Raiser’s Edge and Long Fasthand

 ▪ Extensive experience in Office Management and Personnel Policies

 ▪ Coordinated company events and established audio Visual Conferencing Fuze
